intro: Elaphrium covillei, commonly known as the Coville's elaphrium, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
